alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 10:35AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. * WHERE...In Colorado, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. In Kansas, Cheyenne County. In Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A small deviation in the track of the system may higher or slightly lower than current forecasted snowfall amounts. Strong north winds gusting around 50-55 mph are forecast which may lead to periods of near blizzard to blizzard conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
